title: Video: Extinction Rebellion protester dragged off Tube at Canning Town
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

This is the moment that angry commuters at Canning Town took matters into their own hand and fought back against Extinction Rebellion.

The climate change activists have planned a day of disruption across the London Underground and two managed to climb on to a Tube Train where they unfurled a banner.

However, people trying to use public transport to get to work quickly became hostile and started throwing items at the men.

They started hurling items at them and shouted abuse after being turfed of the Jubilee Line train and ordered to leave the station.

Hundreds refused to evacuate and stayed on the platform while Tube workers blocked the doors.

A man manged to get onto the Tube train to pull the protester off the top of the carriage (Picture: ITN)

Commuters have started a fight back against the disruption Extinction Rebellion has caused (Picture: ITN)

But then commuters started trying to get onto the train as well and managed to pull the protesters’ banner off them.

Eventually a man managed to grab hold of one of the demonstrators’ legs and pulled him onto the floor.

A mob quickly gathered around him and people appeared to attack him before a Tube worker and other passengers stepped in to protect him.

Police arrived and arrested a number of people, including the two protesters, and the events at Canning Town led to severe delays on the rest of the line.

There is disruption elsewhere on the DLR line in Stratford and at Shadwell where a protester has managed to glue his hand to the train.

A number of people have been arrested following the trouble at Canning Town (Picture: ITN)
